approach_recommendations.engage: Verify the correct landowner name and parcel number through a physical deed search at the Lee County Assessor's office before attempting contact.

The Parcel Identification Number (PIN) 025-00-00-055-000 is associated with a property in Marion County, SC, listed in delinquent tax sale records under a different owner [Marion County Tax Collector](https://ctldd.com/listing_pdf/SC-Marion_County-RedeemableDeed-2015-11-02-Raw.pdf). neighbors.name: Lee County Landfill SC, LLC
neighbors.claims: Lee County Landfill SC, LLC is a subsidiary of Republic Services, a major waste management corporation, and owns the Lee County Landfill located at 1431 Sumter Hwy [Lee County Public Works](https://www.leecountysc.org/directory/departments___elected_officials/public_works.php). The entity has demonstrated a supportive stance toward renewable energy; in 2017, the Lee County Council approved a zoning reclassification for the landfill property to facilitate a solar farm investment, a motion supported by the landfill's management [Lee County Council Minutes](https://www.leecountysc.org/county_council/council_minutes/2017_minutes.php). Furthermore, the facility hosts a renewable natural gas (RNG) plant developed in partnership with Ameresco, which began commercial operations in 2025, converting landfill gas into pipeline-quality energy [Ameresco](https://www.ameresco.com/ameresco-and-republic-services-launch-another-renewable-natural-gas-facility-at-lee-county-landfill/). The site is a significant industrial operation with established ties to county infrastructure and energy development.
neighbors.influence_justification: Major industrial landowner and taxpayer (Republic Services); active partner in county-level energy and infrastructure projects.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage as a strategic partner. Republic Services has a proven track record of co-locating renewable energy projects (solar and RNG) on this specific site. Highlight synergies with their existing Ameresco RNG plant and 2017 solar zoning approval.

citations.claim: owns the Lee County Landfill located at 1431 Sumter Hwy
citations.title: Lee County Public Works Directory

citations.claim: Lee County Council approved a zoning reclassification for the landfill property to facilitate a solar farm investment
citations.title: Lee County Council Regular Meeting Minutes August 8, 2017

citations.claim: hosts a renewable natural gas (RNG) plant developed in partnership with Ameresco, which began commercial operations in 2025
citations.title: Ameresco and Republic Services Launch Another Renewable Natural Gas Facility at Lee County Landfill

neighbors.verification_notes: Corrected name from 'LCSWF Real Estate LLC' to 'Lee County Landfill SC, LLC' (Republic Services) based on the draft's description of the 'county landfill' and 'Republic Services' ties. Note: 'LCSWF' is also an acronym used by Terra Nova Solutions for a separate waste facility in the county, but the draft's context (Republic Services, landfill) points to the Republic entity. Verified supportive stance via 2017 solar zoning request and 2025 RNG plant launch.

neighbors.name: Wateree Holdings LLC
neighbors.claims: Wateree Holdings LLC is a landholding entity managed by Forest Investment Associates (FIA), a major timberland investment management organization [York County Deeds](https://search.yorkdeeds.com/view_image.php?file=L2ltZy9zYy95b3JrLzIwMTQvMDcyNC8yMDE0MDAyNjQzNTUudGlm&type=pdf). The company holds significant timberland assets across South Carolina, including parcels in Fairfield, Dillon, and York counties, often acquired from major forestry firms like Weyerhaeuser [Fairfield County Council](https://www.fairfieldsc.com/uploads/uploads/1052015125835PM.pdf). Wateree Holdings LLC has been a recipient of USDA agricultural subsidies for conservation and commodity programs [EWG Farm Subsidy Database](https://farm.ewg.org/persondetail.php?custnumber=A12767556). The entity functions as an institutional timber investment vehicle rather than a traditional family farm.
neighbors.influence_justification: Institutional landowner (Forest Investment Associates) with significant acreage across the state; likely transactional approach to land use.

approach_recommendations.engage: Contact Forest Investment Associates (FIA) in Atlanta, GA, who manages this entity. As an institutional timber investor, they are likely familiar with solar lease structures and may be open to development if it aligns with their portfolio strategy.

citations.claim: managed by Forest Investment Associates (FIA), a major timberland investment management organization
citations.title: York County Deed Book 14260 Page 224

neighbors.verification_notes: Verified entity as a Forest Investment Associates (FIA) subsidiary. Note: The specific PINs provided in the draft (025-00-00-076-000) could not be verified in Lee County and resemble PIN formats in Marion/Dillon counties where Wateree also owns land. However, the entity is a valid SC landowner. Removed specific subsidy dollar amounts per privacy policy.
